meanings.definition: A shallow place in a river or stream where one can cross on foot or by vehicle.
meanings.sent1: The hikers crossed the ford carefully.
meanings.sent2: The car drove through the ford without any issues.
meanings.sent3: The ford was so shallow that even a child could wade through it.
meanings.sent4: The ford acted as a natural bridge over the stream.
meanings.sent5: The ford was a convenient shortcut for the travelers.

meanings.definition: To cross a river or stream at a shallow place.
meanings.sent1: The explorers decided to ford the river to reach the other side.
meanings.sent2: She forded the stream confidently, knowing it was not too deep.
meanings.sent3: The family had to ford the river to get to the picnic spot on the other side.
meanings.sent4: He forded the stream swiftly, eager to continue his journey.
meanings.sent5: Fording the river was a thrilling adventure for the group of friends.
